name: Aggron
flavorText: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for all Energy cards and show them to your opponent. If you find any Metal Special Energy cards there this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. Put all of those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage. If you do, Aggron does 40 damage to itself.

name: Alakazam
flavorText: Its superb memory lets it recall everything it has experienced from birth. Its IQ exceeds 5,000.
Ability1Text: Once during your opponent's turn, when your opponent's Pokémon uses any Poké-Power, you may discard 2 cards from your hand and prevent all effects of that Poké-Power. (This counts as that Pokémon using its Poké-Power.) This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Alakazam by attacks from your opponent's Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Ambipom
flavorText: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
Attack1Text: Your opponent flips a coin until he or she gets heads. For each tails, remove an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and put it on the bottom of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Before Ambipom does damage, your opponent may discard 2 cards from his or her hand. If he or she does, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 80.

name: Azelf
flavorText: Known as "The Being of Willpower." It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
Ability1Text: If you have Uxie and Mesprit in play, the attack cost of each of your opponent's Basic Pokémon's attacks is Colorless more. You can't use more than 1 Downer Material Poké-Body each turn.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, your opponent can't attach any Special Energy cards from his or her hand to any of his or her Pokémon.

name: Blissey
flavorText: This kindhearted Pokémon nurses sick Pokémon to health. It senses feelings of sadness.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Happiny is anywhere under Blissey, you may choose a number of cards in your hand up to the amount of Energy attached to Blissey and put those cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, draw that many cards. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 for each Energy attached to Blissey. Before doing damage, you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Blissey.

name: Bronzong
flavorText: One caused a news sensation when it was dug up at a construction site after a 2,000-year sleep.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. Then, discard a card from your hand. If you discard an Energy card, draw 1 more card. This power can't be used if Bronzong is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Celebi
flavorText: It has the power to travel across time, but is is said to appear only in peaceful times.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to Celebi. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: You may move any number of basic Grass Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Feraligatr
flavorText: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.
Attack1Text: Choose as many Energy cards from your hand as you like and show them to your opponent. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards you chose. Put those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

name: Garchomp
flavorText: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
Ability1Text: If an Active Pokémon has Weakness to any of the types of Energy attached to Garchomp, Garchomp's attacks do 40 more damage to that Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Rainbow Scale Poké-Body can't be used if Garchomp has any Special Energy cards attached to it.

name: Honchkrow
flavorText: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous MURKROW in tow.
Ability1Text: As long as Honchkrow has the Energy necessary to use its attack, each of your Murkrow can use Honchkrow's attack as its own without the Energy necessary to use that attack.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

name: Lumineon
flavorText: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Lumineon is your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has a maximum HP of 100 or more and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Lumineon is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lumineon. Then, return all Water Energy attached to Lumineon to your hand.

name: Magmortar
flavorText: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: If Magby isn't anywhere under Magmortar, discard 2 Energy cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 Energy cards from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

name: Meganium
flavorText: Its breath has the fantastic ability to revive dead plants and flowers.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. If the first coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If the second coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If the third coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Fire Pokémon in play, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Mesprit
flavorText: Known as "The Being of Emotion." It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
Ability1Text: If you have Uxie and Azelf in play, the Retreat Cost for each Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf (both yours and your opponent's) is 0.
Attack1Text: You may switch Mesprit with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Raichu
flavorText: It turns aggressive if it has too much electricity in its body. It discharges power through its tail.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Discard all basic Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded.

name: Typhlosion
flavorText: It attacks using blasts of fire. It creates heat shimmers with intense fire to hide itself.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard a Water Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Tyranitar
flavorText: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage and discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 80 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

name: Uxie
flavorText: Known as "The Being of Knowledge." It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
Ability1Text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Uxie is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Uxie is Knocked Out), you may use this power. The Attacking Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack1Text: If you have Mesprit and Azelf in play, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Abomasnow
flavorText: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.
Ability1Text: If Abomasnow is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Abomasnow is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

name: Ariados
flavorText: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.
Ability1Text: The Retreat Cost for each player's Pokémon (excluding Ariados) is Colorless more.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Bastiodon
flavorText: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.
Attack1Text: If Bastiodon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Chimecho
flavorText: To knock foes flying, it makes the air shudder with its cries. It converses using seven cries.
Attack1Text: Draw a card. If Chingling is anywhere under Chimecho, draw 2 more cards.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, that Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Crobat
flavorText: Having four wings enables it to fly faster and more quietly. It turns active when the night comes.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Crobat from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If tails, shuffle Crobat and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

name: Exeggutor
flavorText: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an EXEGGCUTE.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each basic Energy card attached to Exeggutor and to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Glalie
flavorText: To protect itself, it clads its body in an armor of ice, made by freezing moisture in the air.
Ability1Text: As long as Glalie is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by attacks from your opponent's Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards or Supporter cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

name: Gyarados
flavorText: Once it appears, its rage never settles until it has razed the fields and mountains around it.
Ability1Text: Gyarados can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.) If Gyarados uses any attack from its Basic Pokémon, that attack does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it. If the first coin is tails, Gyarados is now Confused.

name: Kricketune
flavorText: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Kricketot and each Kricketune you have in play.

name: Manectric
flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage times the number of basic Energy cards attached to Manectric.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that is the same type as the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Mantine
flavorText: When the waves are calm, one may encounter a swarm of Mantine swimming as if they are in flight.
Ability1Text: If Mantyke is anywhere under Mantine, the Retreat Cost for each of your Water Pokémon is ColorlessColorless less.
Attack1Text: Mantine can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

name: Mr. Mime
flavorText: It is a pantomime expert that can create invisible but solid walls using miming gestures.
Ability1Text: If your opponent's Pokémon that has 2 or less Energy cards attached to it attacks Mr. Mime, prevent all damage done to Mr. Mime from that attack. If Mime Jr. is anywhere under Mr. Mime, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Mr. Mime.
Attack1Text: Put a coin next to your Active Pokémon without showing your opponent and cover it with your hand. Your opponent guesses if the coin is heads or tails. If he or she is wrong, this attack does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If he or she is right, Mr. Mime does 20 damage to itself, and this attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Nidoqueen
flavorText: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.
Ability1Text: The attack cost of your Nidoran ♀, Nidorina, Nidoran ♂, Nidorino, and Nidoking's attacks is Colorless less.
Attack1Text: If you have the same number of or less Benched Pokémon than your opponent, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 90.

name: Ninetales
flavorText: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Ninetales is the same type as that Pokémon (all if that Pokémon is more than 1 type) until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Ninetales is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Ninetales.

name: Rampardos
flavorText: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
Attack1Text: As long as the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP is 60 or less, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.
Attack2Text: Rampardos does 20 damage to itself. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Slaking
flavorText: The world's laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Slaking is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, Slaking's Lazy Blow attack's base damage is 130 during this turn. If tails, Slaking can't attack or retreat during this turn. (If Slaking is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)

name: Sudowoodo
flavorText: Despite appearing to be a tree, its body is closer to rocks and stones. It is very weak to water.
Attack1Text: If Bonsly is anywhere under Sudowoodo, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Sudowoodo during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Toxicroak
flavorText: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
Ability1Text: Your opponent can't remove the Special Condition Poisoned by evolving or devolving his or her Poisoned Pokémon. (This also includes putting a Pokémon Level-Up card onto the Poisoned Pokémon.)
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Unown [I]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown I, Unown T, Unown E, and Unown M on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 ITEM Poké-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: Choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and put it face down. Treat that card as a Special Energy card that provides Colorless Energy and doesn't have any effect other than providing Energy. Put that card face up at the end of your opponent's next turn.

name: Ursaring
flavorText: In its territory, it leaves scratches on trees that bear delicious berries or fruits.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon's attacks do 60 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: If Teddiursa is on your Bench, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage. If Teddiursa is on your Bench and has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage and remove all damage counters from that Pokémon.

name: Walrein
flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Walrein from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may flip 2 coins. If both are heads, discard 1 of the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)
Attack1Text: If your opponent doesn't discard a card from his or her hand, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Whiscash
flavorText: It is very territorial. It repels foes by setting of tremors that extend over a three-mile radius.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on Whiscash.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Bayleef
flavorText: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Chingling
flavorText: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chimecho from your hand onto Chingling (this counts as evolving Chingling) and remove all damage counters from Chingling.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Cranidos
flavorText: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Croconaw
flavorText: Once it bites down, it won't let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Croconaw from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose all Energy cards you find there, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Dewgong
flavorText: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
Ability1Text: As long as Dewgong is Asleep, any damage done to Dewgong by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Dewgong is now Asleep.

name: Dodrio
flavorText: When DODUO evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Dunsparce
flavorText: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Switch Dunsparce with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Gabite
flavorText: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scale will heal even incurable illnesses.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads put 4 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, remove 4 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Girafarig
flavorText: Its tail also has a small brain. It bites to repel any foe trying to sneak up on it from behind.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Golbat
flavorText: It loves the blood of humans and Pokémon. It flies around at night in search of neck veins.
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand.

name: Graveler
flavorText: GRAVELER make their homes on sheer cliff faces by gouging out numerous horizontal holes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Happiny
flavorText: It loves round white things. It carries and egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chansey from your hand onto Happiny (this counts as evolving Happiny) and remove all damage counters from Happiny.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Lairon
flavorText: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Lairon. If you do, remove 2 damage counters from Lairon.

name: Magmar
flavorText: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to Magmar.

name: Masquerain
flavorText: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage times the number of Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Water Pokémon in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Nidorina
flavorText: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than NIDORINO's.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

name: Octillery
flavorText: It lives in the gaps of boulders and in holes on the seafloor. Its suction cups grip prey tightly.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. Then, discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Parasect
flavorText: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls PARASECT. It scatters poisonous spores.
Attack1Text: If Parasect evolved from Paras during this turn, this attack does 40 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Parasect.

name: Pupitar
flavorText: Its body is as hard as bedrock. By venting pressurized gas, it can launch itself like a rocket.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Pupitar does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Pupitar by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

name: Quilava
flavorText: It intimidates foes with the heat of its flames. The fire burn more strongly when it readies to fight.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Quilava.

name: Sandslash
flavorText: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if Sandslash is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Sandslash is Knocked Out), put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, that Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Sealeo
flavorText: It habitually spins things on its nose. By doing so, it learns textures and odors.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Shieldon
flavorText: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Shieldon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Tropius
flavorText: Because it continually ate only its favorite fruit, the fruit started growing around its neck.
Attack1Text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it.
Attack2Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Unown [E]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown E is on your Bench, you may discard all cards attached to Unown E and attach Unown E to 1 of your Pokémon as a Pokémon Tool card. As long as Unown E is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon gets +10 HP.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever your opponent flips a coin, treat it as tails.

name: Unown [M]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown M is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Unown M is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and this attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Unown [T]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown T is your Active Pokémon, you may discard a card from your hand. Then, flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Unown T is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand and choose 1 card, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck. Then, show your opponent your hand and he or she chooses 1 card. Shuffle that card into your deck.

name: Vigoroth
flavorText: Its heart beats at a tenfold tempo, so it cannot sit still even for a moment.
Attack1Text: If Vigoroth evolved from Slakoth during this turn and Slakoth was Asleep, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 10.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Abra
flavorText: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. Even when awake, it teleports itself while remaining seated.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other 4 cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for Alakazam and put it on Abra (this counts as evolving Abra). Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Aipom
flavorText: It uses its tail to pluck fruits that are out of reach. Its tail is more adept than its real hands.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to that Pokémon.

name: Aron
flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.
Attack1Text: Aron does 10 damage to itself.

name: Barboach
flavorText: It coats its entire body with a slimy fluid so it can squirm and slip away if grabbed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Bronzor
flavorText: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Buizel
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Chansey
flavorText: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey by attacks during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Chansey does 60 damage to itself.

name: Chikorita
flavorText: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Croagunk
flavorText: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Cyndaquil
flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

name: Doduo
flavorText: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Doduo can't use Accelerating Stab during your next turn.

name: Electrike
flavorText: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach any Energy cards from his or her hand to the Active Pokémon during his or her next turn.

name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Exeggcute. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. For each heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Finneon
flavorText: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Finneon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Geodude
flavorText: Many live on mountain trails and remain half buried while keeping an eye on climbers.
Attack1Text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Gible
flavorText: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Kricketot
flavorText: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Larvitar
flavorText: A Pokémon that eats soil. Once it has eaten a large mountain, it goes to sleep so it can grow.
Attack1Text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If you do, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage and Larvitar is now Asleep.

name: Magby
flavorText: Its body temperature is around 1,100 degrees F. It is healthy if it is breathing yellow flames.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Magmar from your hand onto Magby (this counts as evolving Magby) and remove all damage counters from Magby.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Magikarp
flavorText: It is said to be the world's weakest Pokémon. No one knows why it has managed to survive.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Murkrow
flavorText: It is believed that seeing this Pokémon at night will bring about ominous occurrences.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for Murkrow and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Switch Murkrow with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Nidoran ♀
flavorText: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from barbs can be fatal.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for Nidoran ♂ or Nidoran ♀ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Paras
flavorText: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host PARAS.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Pichu
flavorText: The electric pouches on its cheeks are still small. They cannot store much electricity yet.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the pouches on its cheeks.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Pichu is anywhere under Pikachu, you may search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. This power can't be used if Pikachu is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Remoraid
flavorText: It squirts water forcefully from its mouth to shoot down flying prey.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Sandshrew
flavorText: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Seel
flavorText: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Shinx
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Shinx.

name: Slakoth
flavorText: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.
Attack1Text: Both Slakoth and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

name: Snorunt
flavorText: In the snow country, certain folklore says a house will prosper if a SNORUNT lives there.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Snover
flavorText: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Snover does 10 damage to itself.

name: Spheal
flavorText: It rolls across ice floes to reach shore because its body is poorly shaped for swimming.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your next turn, Spheal's Rollout attack's base damage is 40.

name: Spinarak
flavorText: It sets a trap by spinning a web with thin but strong silk. It waits motionlessly for prey to arrive.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Surskit
flavorText: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Teddiursa
flavorText: It lets honey soak into its paws so it can lick them all the time. Every sets of paws tastes unique.
Attack1Text: Remove all Special Conditions and 2 damage counters from Teddiursa. Teddiursa is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Before doing damage, remove 1 damage counter from the Defending Pokémon.

name: Totodile
flavorText: It has the habit of biting anything with its developed jaws. Even its Trainer need to be careful.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Zubat
flavorText: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Armor Fossil
Ability1Text: Whenever Armor Fossil would be damaged by your opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, reduce that damage by 10.

name: Skull Fossil
Ability1Text: During your opponent's turn, if Skull Fossil would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Electivire LV.X
Ability1Text: As long as Electivire is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Discard all of your opponent's Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play. If you do, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Electivire during your opponent's next turn.

name: Lucario LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Lucario LV.X from your hand onto your Active Lucario, you may use this power. Prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Lucario during your opponent's next turn. (If Lucario is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Lucario by attacks is increased by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Magmortar LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Magmortar is your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Burned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 2 on that Pokémon between turns. This power can't be used if Magmortar is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Magmortar. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) During your next turn, Magmortar can't use Flame Bluster.
